code: cars.lo <- loess(dist ~ speed, cars) calculate_bic(cars.lo) #>      BIC  #> 287.1964

what: Compute relevant expression statistics for each gene. — calculate_gpr

Compute relevant expression statistics for each gene. — calculate_gpr
text: counts single-cell expression matrix rows represent genes columns represent cells.

title: Compute relevant expression statistics for each gene. — calculate_gpr
text: Return data.table row represents gene, four columns: average expression level, positive ratio, positive cell count, gene name.

title: Compute relevant expression statistics for each gene. — calculate_gpr
code: library(GLP) counts <- matrix(sample(0:10,3000*1000, replace = TRUE), nrow = 3000, ncol = 1000) rownames(counts) <- paste0("gene",1:3000) gene.info <- calculate_gpr(counts)

what: GLP selection of high variable genes — glp
title: GLP selection of high variable genes — glp
GLP selection of high variable genes — glp
GLP selection of high variable genes — glp
text: df data.table row represents gene, four columns: average expression level, positive ratio, positive cell count, gene name. npc Minimum number cells gene must expressed. nfeatures number high variable genes.

title: GLP selection of high variable genes — glp
text: list containing three elements: 1.Genes.summary: input data.table summary statistics gene. 2.Genes.regression: data.table main results robust LOESS regression. 3.HVG: vector highly variable genes identified analysis."

title: GLP selection of high variable genes — glp
code: library(GLP) counts <- matrix(sample(0:10,3000*1000, replace = TRUE), nrow = 3000, ncol = 1000) rownames(counts) <- paste0("gene",1:3000) gene.info <- calculate_gpr(counts) result <- glp(gene.info, 3, 1000) #> Warning: pseudoinverse used at 0.909 #> Warning: neighborhood radius 0.001 #> Warning: reciprocal condition number  0 #> Warning: There are other near singularities as well. 1e-06 #> Warning: pseudoinverse used at 0.909 #> Warning: neighborhood radius 0.001 #> Warning: reciprocal condition number  0 #> Warning: There are other near singularities as well. 1e-06

what: LOESS with Tukey’s biweight robust statistical method — robust_loess
title: LOESS with Tukey’s biweight robust statistical method — robust_loess
text: LOESS Tukey’s biweight robust statistical method

title: LOESS with Tukey’s biweight robust statistical method — robust_loess
code: robust_loess(x, y, span = span, iterations = 1, percentage = 0.2)

title: LOESS with Tukey’s biweight robust statistical method — robust_loess
text: x vector Predictor Variable y vector Response Variable span parameter α controls degree smoothing. iterations Number iterations outlier detection. percentage parameter controlling window size outlier detection.

title: LOESS with Tukey’s biweight robust statistical method — robust_loess
text: list containing three elements: 1.weight: gene weight LOESS regression(outliers 0). 2.local_mads: gene's local median absolute deviation. 3.model: final robust LOESS regression model.
